xxl.io
Class IteratorInputStream

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.io.InputStream
        |
        +--xxl.io.IteratorInputStream
public class IteratorInputStream
extends InputStream

This class provides an input stream that depends on a given iterator. The objects of the iteration must extend the abstract class Number in order to be converted to int and returned by the read method.

Example usage (1). 

     // create a new list

     List list = new ArrayList();

     // add some integers to that list

     list.add(new Integer(1));
     list.add(new Integer(10));
     list.add(new Integer(100));
     list.add(new Integer(1000));
     list.add(new Integer(10000));
     list.add(new Integer(100000));
     list.add(new Integer(1000000));
     list.add(new Integer(10000000));

     // create a new iterator input stream

     IteratorInputStream input = new IteratorInputStream(list.iterator());

     // print all data of the iterator input stream

     try {
         int i = 0;
         while ((i = input.read()) != -1)
             System.out.println(i);
     }
     catch (IOException ioe) {
         System.out.println("An I/O error occured.");
     }

See Also:
Cursor, InputStream, IOException, Iterator, IteratorCursor

Constructor Detail

IteratorInputStream

public IteratorInputStream(Cursor cursor)
Constructs a new IteratorInputStream that depends on the specified cursor.
Parameters:
cursor - the cursor that contains the Number objects for the input stream.

IteratorInputStream

public IteratorInputStream(Iterator iterator)
Constructs a new IteratorInputStream that depends on the specified iterator. In order to add Cursor functionality to the given iterator it is wrapped by an IteratorCursor.
Parameters:
iterator - the iterator that contains the Number objects for the input stream.
Method Detail

read

public int read()
         throws IOException
Reads the next byte of data from the input stream. The value byte is returned as an int in the range 0 to 255. If no byte is available because the end of the stream has been reached, the value -1 is returned.
This implementation takes the next object of the iteration and casts it to Number. Thereafter the last 8 bit (an int in the range 0 to 255) of the int value of the Number object are returned.
Overrides:
read in class InputStream
Returns:
the next byte of data, or -1 if the end of the stream is reached.
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

close

public void close()
Closes this input stream and releases any system resources associated with the stream.
This implementation calls the close method of the underlying cursor.
Overrides:
close in class InputStream

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples how to use an IteratorInputStream. It can also be used to test the functionality of an IteratorInputStream.
Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
